intro: Galium densiflorum, commonly known as denseflower bedstraw, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant features small, white to pinkish flowers arranged in dense clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its characteristic appearance. Galium densiflorum thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
